DataElement.preferredName: Patient Bone Marrow Biopsy And/Or Bone Marrow Aspiration Within Period Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator for whether or not bone marrow biopsy and or bone marrow aspiration procedure was performed within given period to determine study eligibility.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Bone Marrow Biopsy And/Or Bone Marrow Aspiration Within Period Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A biopsy involving the removal of a core tissue containing bone spicules and hematopoietic elements embedded in the marrow stroma.  This procedure is done in the hip area mainly for the diagnosis and evaluation of neoplastic and non-neoplastic hematopoietic disorders (e.g. anemias, leukemias, lymphomas) and the evaluation of the spread of solid tumors (e.g. carcinomas, sarcomas) and lymphomas for therapeutic purposes._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Aspiration of immature hematopoietic elements and blood from the bone marrow.  It is done for the evaluation of hematopoietic disorders and for the evaluation of infectious diseases and cytogenetic studies._On the inside; contained in._An interval of time._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Bone Marrow Biopsy And/Or Bone Marrow Aspiration Within Period Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: A biopsy involving the removal of a core tissue containing bone spicules and hematopoietic elements embedded in the marrow stroma.  This procedure is done in the hip area mainly for the diagnosis and evaluation of neoplastic and non-neoplastic hematopoietic disorders (e.g. anemias, leukemias, lymphomas) and the evaluation of the spread of solid tumors (e.g. carcinomas, sarcomas) and lymphomas for therapeutic purposes.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:A procedure in which a small sample of bone marrow is removed, usually from the hip bone, breastbone, or thigh bone. A small area of skin and the surface of the bone underneath are numbed with an anesthetic. Then, a special wide needle is pushed into the bone. A sample of liquid bone marrow is removed with a syringe attached to the needle. The bone marrow is sent to a laboratory to be looked at under a microscope. This procedure may be done at the same time as a bone marrow biopsy.:On the inside; contained in.:An interval of time.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A biopsy involving the removal of a core tissue containing bone spicules and hematopoietic elements embedded in the marrow stroma.  This procedure is done in the hip area mainly for the diagnosis and evaluation of neoplastic and non-neoplastic hematopoietic disorders (e.g. anemias, leukemias, lymphomas) and the evaluation of the spread of solid tumors (e.g. carcinomas, sarcomas) and lymphomas for therapeutic purposes.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

Aspiration of immature hematopoietic elements and blood from the bone marrow.  It is done for the evaluation of hematopoietic disorders and for the evaluation of infectious diseases and cytogenetic studies.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.
